      • snapToGridLine

        public static void snapToGridLine(Odometer odometer,
                  boolean withLightSensorOffset)
        Snaps to a given gridline. Given a position, the method will determine the heading of the robot (either the x or y component) and determine the closest gridline to it's current position in said heading
        Parameters:
        position -
        odometer -

      • determineLightOffset

        public static double[] determineLightOffset()
        When a line is detected, and assuming the vehicle is orthogonal to the line, the vehicle is pointed towards either N, E, S or W. Depending on this direction, the position of the light sensors will be differently offset from the origin of the robot. The origin of the robot is located in the center of the wheel base. The following are the offsets:
        1. E: x - 13cm
        2. W: x + 13cm
        3. N: y - 13cm
        4. S: y + 13cm
        This function returns a double array with two elements: xOffset and yOffset. NOTE: one of these components will always be 0. The other will either be ±#VERT_DIST_FROM_LIGHT_SENSORS_TO_WHEEL_BASE DISTANCE_FROM_LIGHT_SENSORS_TO_WHEEL_BASE

      • snapToHeading

        public static void snapToHeading(Odometer odometer)
        Snaps to a heading, given the current odometer heading
        Parameters:
        odometer -

      • setTunnelOrientation

        public static void setTunnelOrientation(int llx,
                        int lly,
                        int urx,
                        int ury)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the tunnel's #curTunnelOrientation orientation to the correct TUNNEL_ORIENTATION. This orientation is computed by comparing the length and height of the tunnel to see which is larger. (length > height ==> HORIZONTAL), (height > length ==> VERTICLE)
        Parameters:
        llx - - lower left x of tunnel
        lly - - lower left y of tunnel
        urx - - upper right x of tunnel
        ury - - upper right y of tunnel
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the tunnel length or height is invalid (I.E doesn't form a rectangle that's 2x1 or 1x2)

      • getTunnelOrientation

        public static Board.TUNNEL_ORIENTATION getTunnelOrientation()
        Getter for the tunnel orientation relative to starting corner 0.
        Returns:
